On Monday, February 24, 2003, at 11:25 PM, Berend de Boer wrote:
> Hello All,
>
> I'm looking for information regarding support for DELETE/PUT via a
> standard web browser. Browsing through the archive it seems you need a
> kludge to do that.

correct.

> 1. If so, what technique is preferable? Hidden field? URL rewriting?

if you mean rewriting to include the method, as in ?method=foo then 
that is NOT preferable because it results in a GET with side-effects; 
GETs are supposed to be idempotent.

frequently, POST and PUT are not applicable to the same resource (at 
least in my experience), so you can overload POST to do what you want.  
i pre-process such POST requests on the server (this is arguably an 
intermediary in REST nomenclature) to call PUT code instead.

delete can be done with a hidden (or submit) form field.

> 2. Do browsers support it after all??

only via XMLHttpRequest.

HTH,
-vincent
